bk.title: The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers, Geniuses, and Geeks Created the Digital Revolution
bk.subtitle: A History of the Computer and the Internet
bk.author: Walter Isaacson
bk.description: In this book, Walter Isaacson tells the fascinating story of the people who created the computer and the internet.

bk.title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
bk.subtitle: The Universe in a Nutshell
bk.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
bk.description: This book offers a quick overview of the universe and the science behind it, perfect for the busy reader.

bk.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
bk.subtitle: From Prehistory to the Present
bk.author: Yuval Noah Harari
bk.description: Sapiens explores how Homo sapiens became the dominant species on Earth, weaving together history and science.

bk.title: The Martian
bk.subtitle: A Novel
bk.author: Andy Weir
bk.description: This gripping novel tells the story of an astronaut stranded on Mars and his struggle to survive.

bk.title: The Space Between Worlds
bk.subtitle: A Novel
bk.author: Micaiah Johnson
bk.description: In a multiverse where travel is possible, the only worlds you can visit are the ones where your alternate self is dead.

bk.title: The Gene: An Intimate History
bk.subtitle: From the Discovery of DNA to Genetic Engineering
bk.author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
bk.description: This book is a comprehensive history of the gene and its significance in our understanding of biology.
